We feel it is important to make a decision on the 2020 Prom now, so that students and parents have an opportunity to make appropriate plans concerning their schedules and rental/purchasing decisions.

After consultation with Des Moines County Public Health and a review of the governor’s latest proclamation which states that for mass gatherings “The gathering organizer must ensure at least six feet of distance between each group or individual attending alone.” It was determined that six foot social distancing is not feasible in a dance setting.

Therefore, with the health and safety of our students at the forefront of our thoughts and concerns, we are sad to announce that the 2020 Mediapolis High School Prom is cancelled.

As you may know, Governor Reynolds announced yesterday that baseball and softball may begin June 1.

Today, superintendents across the state received further guidance from the Iowa Department of Education. We were informed that junior high sports will remain suspended through June 30. It’s important to note that junior high sports are not affiliated with the Iowa High School Athletic Association or the Iowa Girls High School Athletic Union.

As a result of this guidance, the Southeast Iowa Super Conference is canceling junior high baseball and softball for the 2020 summer season. Per IHSAA & IGHSAU rules, eighth-grade students are eligible to play high school baseball and softball if they elect to do so. Contact Activity Director Mike Wolter (wolterm@mepoedu.org) with questions.

This has certainly been an unusual year with winter weather! Students have missed 10 days of school. In my 32 years as an educator, I remember only one other time we missed this much school due to weather.

When we built our 2018-2019 school calendar we included 2 snow makeup days, but having 8 additional days to makeup has created significant challenges for students, families, and school staff. After a great deal of thought, weighing options, many conversations with parents, board members and teachers, we have developed a revised school schedule that will allow us to make up the missed instructional time and have students complete the school year on May 24th. Please use the Link below to see a revised schedule for the remaining portion of the 2018-2019 school year.

Please notice starting March 4th we will be adding 30 minutes to the end of each school day.

http://www.meposchools.org/wp-content/files/2019/02/Snow-Day-Makeup-Plan.pdf
